TopicTitle: The most confusing and baffling in science? (QuantumMechanics\Double Slit experiment)

Articles.Content:
Wow... I can't believe the mods haven't intervened when we've got such unscientific stuff on here as someone defending intelligent design and heliocentrism (in the greater sense of the universe, not restricted to our local solar system)/geocentrism (in other words: Earth's position is special) as "scientific".

Intelligent design makes no testable predictions and can only generate ad hoc explanations.

Ditto with geocentrism.

And btw, redshift is a measurable effect of velocity. Relativity and the weird effects of higher velocity have been confirmed even here on Earth without looking out to the stars.

Do we need to call in a moderator?

12 hours ago, KerikBalm said:

Wow... I can't believe the mods haven't intervened when we've got such unscientific stuff on here as someone defending intelligent design and heliocentrism (in the greater sense of the universe, not restricted to our local solar system)/geocentrism (in other words: Earth's position is special) as "scientific".

Intelligent design makes no testable predictions and can only generate ad hoc explanations.

Ditto with geocentrism.

And btw, redshift is a measurable effect of velocity. Relativity and the weird effects of higher velocity have been confirmed even here on Earth without looking out to the stars.

Do we need to call in a moderator?

No, because this is FOUR YEARS old

12 hours ago, KerikBalm said:

Wow... I can't believe the mods haven't intervened when we've got such unscientific stuff on here as someone defending intelligent design and heliocentrism (in the greater sense of the universe, not restricted to our local solar system)/geocentrism (in other words: Earth's position is special) as "scientific".

Intelligent design makes no testable predictions and can only generate ad hoc explanations.

Ditto with geocentrism.

And btw, redshift is a measurable effect of velocity. Relativity and the weird effects of higher velocity have been confirmed even here on Earth without looking out to the stars.

Do we need to call in a moderator?

Why?  Forgetting the fact that you are responding to a 4 year old post/thread, what you are asking is censorship.  You may not agree with them, but you have no right to decide what can and cannot be posted

Nonetheless, certain topics are forbidden on this forum. Primarily conspiracy theories, but several pseudo-scientific loads of nonsense have been stomped on before, because they inherently do not lead to any constructive discussion.

And administrators of this forum absolutely have the right to decide what does and does not get posted. This isn't a public space in any legal sense.
Oh wow, didn't realize how old the thread was... in my defense, someone else posted the day before I did.. it wasn't me who necro'd it :p
